Un juego muy divertido, interesante y competitivo. Divertido porque consiste en una lucha entre dos equipos (Red and Blue) en las cuales tienen 9 clases de personajes, cada uno con sus personalidades muy particulares y entretenidos, los cuales colaboraran para ganar la partida. Interesante en vista a que incluye otros modos como el MVM, otros juegos alternativos, pero lo que m√°s destaca a mi parecer, es la econom√≠a a trav√©s del intercambio que se pueden realizar entre jugadores o pagians como backpack para obtener items muy valiosos. Y por √∫ltimo competitivo en virtud a que al ser un shooter y el enfrentamiento entre dos equipos, cada uno con sus estrategia, habilidades y un buen trabajo en equipo, trataran de superar al otro logrando los objetivos de cada modo, lo cual conlleva a mejorar la habilidad tanto personal, actitudinal y del mismo juego. Muy recomendado

Gateway to PC first-person-shooters, community is still active after all of the years the game has been up.

Honestly this is one of the best games you can play and always has been. Historically this was a mod created by the online community all the way back in the Quake 1 multiplayer days and has never died. I think that speaks volumes. Plus the designs and unique characters make it a ton of fun. If you get bored playing as one class, change to another and it's a completely different challenge with different strategies you have to employ. There's a lot of maps and you can play on user created mods if you want even more variety. The only negative aspects are that bots have been persistent, however Valve is taking that problem more seriously and patching things which have helped. Hopefully they keep it up. Highly recommended!

Features that tf2 has to offer:
[list]
    [*]bots
    [*]messy menus, the ui consists of layers of spaghetti code.
    [*]more bots
    [*]many bugs, gameplay consists of layers of spaghetti code.
    [*]squads/platoons of bots
    [*]cheaters (wallhacks)
    [*]cheaters (force crits)
    [*]bots that micspam and chatspam
    [*]terrible map design, had to be compensated by placing invisible walls everywhere.
    [*]countless glitchy spots for hidden sentries. Devs don't even bother fixing, let alone banning glitch abusers. In most games bugusing is frowned upon, but in tf2 the community encourages this.
    [*]bots on both teams who don't shoot or kick each other but everybody else.
    [*]no proper matchmaking, teams are usually unbalanced and most matches are one-sided roflstomps.
    [*]"pro players" modify their config to see less clutter (no ragdolls, cleaner ui) in ways that aren't offered by the ingame settings. (In most other competitive multiplayer games, modifying your game files with third-party programs would be considered cheating)
    [*]players who don't know how to kick bots, or even kick you instead.
    [*]more bots.
[/list]

As you can see, after 15 years of development, this game is shÛ†Ä†it. It's not like the game is abandoned though, the devs still regularly release new updates (which mostly consist of new cosmetics, to milk the dead cow even more). The only people who still play this game are old players who are blinded by nostalgia, non-gamers who don't even know what a cheater is, and bots (especially at night your matches will mostly consist of those).

Maybe the game was great, maybe the game used to be fun. I don't know, because I only recently started. I can only review the game in it's current state and the current state is terrible.

Its TF2
If you don't know this game exists by now, just play it.

One of my favourite games of all time. Good variety of classes and just great gameplay overall.

O que falar de Team Fortress 2 ?

Team Fortress 2 is an absolute gem that continues to stand out amongst other FPS games released in this day and age with its unique art style, memorable characters and rewarding gameplay. It evokes many memories of my childhood and of the fun moments with the community which is also what keeps me coming back to this game.
